Based on the paper content, I'll extract the structured information:

```json
{
  "paper_metadata": {
    "title": "Does participation in conditional cash transfers lead to better secondary schools? Evidence from Jamaica's PATH",
    "matches_expected_title": "YES"
  },
  "program_information": {
    "program_name": "Programme of Advancement through Health and Education (PATH)",
    "country": "Jamaica",
    "region": "Urban areas of 10 parishes",
    "target_population": "Poor households with children",
    "program_name_citation": "Jamaica's CCT Programme of Advancement through Health and Education (PATH)",
    "country_citation": "This paper evaluates a graduation program targeting the ultra-poor in Jamaica",
    "target_population_citation": "The objective is to support current consumption (alleviate current poverty) while increasing the demand for health and education among the children of beneficiary households"
  },
  "intervention_components": {
    "component_a_cash_support": {
      "component_a_present": true,
      "cash_support_type": "conditional cash transfer",
      "cash_amount": null,
      "cash_frequency": "monthly",
      "is_loan_or_credit": "NO",
      "cash_evidence_citation": "Conditional cash transfer (CCT) programs have become the main anti-poverty program in many Latin American and Caribbean countries"
    },
    "component_b_assets": {
      "component_b_present": false,
      "assets_provided": [],
      "direct_provision": "NO",
      "assets_evidence_citation": null
    }
  },
  "study_characteristics": {
    "outcomes_measured": [
      "education",
      "school performance",
      "school placement",
      "educational aspirations"
    ],
    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "We find that PATH had a significant impact on the educational trajectory of its urban male beneficiaries. For this group, participation in PATH improved the quality of school placement. This impact appears to be driven by an increase in school performance.",
    "study_design": "Regression Discontinuity Design (RDD)",
    "design_evidence_citation": "Our impact evaluation adopts a regression discontinuity design (RDD). Eligibility for PATH depends on whether the household's PMT score (the assignment variable) is below a fixed eligibility cutoff",
    "is_review_or_policy_analysis": false,
    "publication_year": 2017,
    "study_conducted_year": "2010-2014",
    "sample_size": 2704,
    "completed": true
  },
  "bonus_information": {
    "has_qualitative_components": false,
    "qualitative_methods": [],
    "qualitative_evidence_citation": null,
    "has_cost_data": false,
    "cost_mentions": null,

  }
```
